    • Method Detail

      • enableAp

        boolean enableAp(java.lang.String ssid,
               java.lang.String password)
                 throws RemoteException,
                        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Enables an access point (Wi-Fi network). If the operation succeeds it will broadcast a AP_STATE_ACTION with the result AP_STATE_Enabled (see ChaskiConstants).
        Parameters:
        ssid - SSID access point should have
        password - Password access point should have
        Returns:
        TRUE if invoking of the underlying Android method returns true. Otherwise the method returns FALSE.
        Throws:
        RemoteException
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException

      • disableAp

        boolean disableAp()
                  throws RemoteException
        Disables an access point (Wi-Fi network). If the operation succeeds it will broadcast a AP_STATE_ACTION with the result AP_STATE_DISABLED (see ChaskiConstants).
        Returns:
        TRUE if invoking of the underlying Android method returns true
        Throws:
        RemoteException

      • isApEnabled

        boolean isApEnabled()
                    throws RemoteException
        Checks if the device has deployed an access point (Wi-Fi network).
        Returns:
        TRUE if access point is enabled and otherwise FALSE.
        Throws:
        RemoteException

      • connectToAp

        boolean connectToAp(java.lang.String ssid,
                  java.lang.String password)
                    throws RemoteException
        Triggers the process of connecting to an access point (Wi-Fi network). If the operation succeeds it will broadcast a CONNECTION_STATE_ACTION with the result CONNECTED_STATE (see ChaskiConstants).
        Parameters:
        ssid - SSID of access point
        password - Password of access point
        Returns:
        TRUE if invoking of the underlying Android method returns true. Otherwise the method returns FALSE.
        Throws:
        RemoteException

      • disconnectFromAp

        boolean disconnectFromAp()
                         throws RemoteException
        Triggers the process of disconnecting from an access point (Wi-Fi network). If the operation succeeds it will broadcast a CONNECTION_STATE_ACTION with the result DISCONNECTED_STATE (see ChaskiConstants).
        Returns:
        Throws:
        RemoteException

      • isConnectedToApWithSSID

        boolean isConnectedToApWithSSID(java.lang.String charSequence)
                                throws RemoteException
        Checks if connection to the specified access point is established.
        Parameters:
        charSequence - SSID of access point
        Returns:
        TRUI if connection to access point is established and FALSE otherwise.
        Throws:
        RemoteException

      • isConnectedToApWithPrefix

        boolean isConnectedToApWithPrefix(java.lang.String prefix)
        Checks if a connection any access point is established
        Returns:

      • triggerNumberOfClients

        void triggerNumberOfClients(java.lang.String operationString)
        Method that triggers a ping to each all clients' IP addresses listed in the ARP cache. After having sent a ping to all registered clients Chaski will broadcast a CLIENTS_STATE_ACTION. The BOOLEAN result TRUE or FALSE can be obtained via KEY_CLIENTS_CONNECTED (see ChaskiConstants).
        Parameters:
        operationString - String for app developers to assign a call identifier. For instance, the value of this parameter could be current time stamp.

      • triggerIpAddressesOfClients

        void triggerIpAddressesOfClients(java.lang.String operationString)
        Method that triggers a ping to each all clients' IP addresses listed in the ARP cache. After having sent a ping to all registered clients Chaski will broadcast a CLIENTS_STATE_ACTION. The String array containing IPs of connected clients can be obtained via KEY_STRING_ARRAY_OF_CLIENTS_CONNECTED (in ChaskiConstants).
        Parameters:
        operationString - String for app developers to assign a call identifier. For instance, the value of this parameter could be current time stamp.

      • getWifiApConfiguration

        WifiConfiguration getWifiApConfiguration()
                                         throws RemoteException
        Retrieves the current WifiConfiguration for the access point
        Returns:
        WifiConfiguration, e.g. config.SSID
        Throws:
        RemoteException
